author: jimgeraghty

text: "Clearly, we need the appointment of a new special counsel to investigate why there were no further indictments coming from the first special counsel."
author: jimgeraghty

text: "Is it possible that the remaining indictments were sucked into a black hole or something?"
author: jimgeraghty

text: "But what if this is all a ruse to lure them into false confidence and there's a secret second report by Mueller that has lots of indictments and lays out all of the conclusion and..."
author: jimgeraghty

text: "He's on to us."
author: jimgeraghty

text: "The report is carved on tablets made out of pure plutonium."
author: jimgeraghty

text: "I'm just saying it's possible that either they got to Mueller or maybe they substituted the real Mueller Report with a fake one that recommended no further indictments..."

text: I had to spend a few minutes driving to Spring flag football practice, do we have a new president yet?

author: jimgeraghty

author: jimgeraghty

text: For what it’s worth, this morning she says she wasn’t talking about her personal experience, which… I don’t think is clear at all from the original Tweet, but whatever.
author: jimgeraghty

text: Whatever his flaws, there is absolutely no indication that Buttigieg’s family “bought” his way into Harvard or Oxford or that he didn’t earn his opportunities there.
author: jimgeraghty

text: South Bend is the 299th-largest city in America. Based upon 5 years as mayor, Pete Buttigieg is convinced he’s ready to be president. Some candidates falter because they don’t have “the fire in the belly.” Buttigieg’s got the Hindenberg in his intestines.
author: jimgeraghty

text: This isn’t to say America doesn’t have problems, but the general state of the economy and rate of job creation are not among those problems.
author: jimgeraghty

text:
Not a lot of journalism students are working for Time magazine within two years of graduation. Not many get to work for an HBO series as their stepping-stone job. Hard to paint that as “never experiencing American prosperity."

http://bit.ly/2CIqHDN
author: jimgeraghty

text: Regardless of your personal circumstances, this _is_ American prosperity. https://www.nationalreview.com/the-morning-jolt/millennials-are-experiencing-american-prosperity/ …
author: jimgeraghty

text: I've written "20 Things" profiles of almost all of the presidential candidates. Today it's Buttigieg. I'm sorry if a deep dive into his life and what he's said and done counts as "crapping on" to you.
author: jimgeraghty

text:
A list from 2017 ranks South Bend the 299th-largest city in the United States, just behind Wichita Falls, Texas; Rialto, Calif.; and Davenport, Iowa.

http://bit.ly/2UPXLAz
author: jimgeraghty

text:
An outspoken supporter of the auto-industry bailout in 2009 and 2010, Buttigieg contended, “with remarkable speed, the government had recovered most of the taxpayer money that had gone into the deal.” Depends upon how you define “most."

http://bit.ly/2UPXLAz
author: jimgeraghty

text:
In another column, Pete Buttigieg wrote, “The anthem of our new life came on an arresting new album from Eminem. Tossing expletives at Dick Cheney and Tipper Gore, Eminem was, as he put it, ‘dumping it on White America,’ building a new narrative.” 

http://bit.ly/2UPXLAz
author: jimgeraghty

text:
As a regular columnist for the Harvard Crimson, Pete Buttigieg mocked George W. Bush for his Ivy League elitism and ideological extremism.

http://bit.ly/2UPXLAz
author: jimgeraghty

text:
Presidential candidate Pete Buttigieg on life at Harvard University in 2000: “It began to feel like the academy of X-Men: everyone had some concealed special power: Cate, on the second floor, could read books at four or five times the normal pace.” 

http://bit.ly/2UPXLAz
author: jimgeraghty

text:
In high school, Buttigieg was senior-class president, valedictorian, and president of the school’s chapter of Amnesty International. In his autobiography, he describes his high-school gym teacher as objecting to the group’s focus on “Ay-rabs.”

http://bit.ly/2UPXLAz
author: jimgeraghty

text:
Pete Buttigieg was ten when Bill Clinton was elected president, a college freshman when George W. Bush was elected, and a sophomore on 9/11. One of his first jobs out of college was doing research and press work for John Kerry’s presidential campaign.

http://bit.ly/2UPXLAz
author: jimgeraghty

text: Twenty Things You Probably Didn’t Know About Pete Buttigieg https://www.nationalreview.com/2019/03/pete-buttigieg-biography-views-democratic-presidential-candidate/ …
author: jimgeraghty

text: Just saying, which man has more people on the edge of their seats, desperate to see what happens next and running out of patience?
author: jimgeraghty

text: I know the Mueller report has to really wrap up and get delivered _sometime_. This is the Brexit of investigations, a probe with more delayed endings than George R.R. Martin’s A Song of Fire and Ice series.
author: jimgeraghty

text:
Is there any good evidence to think the Mueller report really is “wrapping up” or “about to be completed”? We’ve been hearing variations of this since last spring.

http://bit.ly/2CwjG8Z
author: jimgeraghty

text:
Congressional Democrats would spend much of 2019 arguing that Trump should be removed from office through impeachment, fall short, then immediately move on to a presidential campaign arguing that Trump should be removed through the ballot box. 

http://bit.ly/2CwjG8Z
author: jimgeraghty

text:
Five months passed from the release of the Starr report to the Senate vote on Bill Clinton. If an impeachment effort against Trump took a similar timetable, the Senate would be voting in September. 

http://bit.ly/2CwjG8Z
author: jimgeraghty

text: The Waning Appetite for Impeachment https://www.nationalreview.com/corner/the-waning-appetite-for-impeachment/ …
author: jimgeraghty

text: Two years and nine months have passed since the referendum.
author: jimgeraghty

text: " 20 things you probably didn't know about that other Coloradoan who you've never heard of"
author: jimgeraghty

text: Another @#$%# 20 Things I gotta do...
author: jimgeraghty

text: Indeed, senator, they are the best.
author: jimgeraghty

text:
If his picks end up being wildly wrong, boy, will his face be red.

But that's an improvement, I guess.
author: jimgeraghty

text:
Electing a Biden-Abrams ticket would lead to either a reelection bid in 2024 or Biden serving one term and VP Abrams running in 2024, then possibly reelection in 2028. Every other Dem might have to put their presidential ambitions on hold until 2032! 

http://bit.ly/2UNKRTL
author: jimgeraghty

text: Because otherwise, comparing a series of novels with shovelfuls of political and social satire and humor to a paranoid racist fantasy feels pretty far from the mark.
author: jimgeraghty

text: I’ve never read "The Turner Diaries,” did it have jokes about Die Hard becoming a Christmas movie, Americans trying to jump a border wall to get into Mexico, airline food being a delicacy, “one of the lesser Cuomos” and code names inspired by the Monkees?
author: jimgeraghty

text: I joined @BiasedGirl's #TJAMS NCAA bracket pool and made the utterly boring and safe choice, picking all favorites and Duke to win it all. Much better odds overall than trying to accurately predict the upsets.
author: jimgeraghty

text: Technically, if you elect him, he gets a motorcade and these sorts of problems can be avoided.
author: jimgeraghty

text:
The 2020 Democratic primary is starting to look like a combination of Thunderdome, the Hundred Years’ War, and The Hunger Games. Dems won’t settle for a slow-motion coronation/forced marriage of the Party Establishment and the progressive grassroots. 

http://bit.ly/2UNKRTL
author: jimgeraghty

text:
Also in today’s Morning Jolt, the rest of the Democratic field is not just gonna pack up and go home if there’s an early announcement of a Biden-Abrams ticket. 

http://bit.ly/2UNKRTL
author: jimgeraghty

text:
A lot of fans of both men will absolutely hate the comparison. But the parallels are there: successful dads, youthful troubles with alcohol, maturing through marriage and fatherhood, charisma on the stump and critics calling each one an empty suit.

http://bit.ly/2UNKRTL
author: jimgeraghty

text:
… but the story of the Texan is also the story of _this guy_. 

http://bit.ly/2UNKRTL
author: jimgeraghty

text:
So yeah, the story of the Texan is the story of this guy…

http://bit.ly/2UNKRTL
author: jimgeraghty

text: He wasn’t always the most eloquent, and sometimes he mangled his message. But a lot of the people who came to hear him speak came away convinced his heart was in the right place and he could restore their optimism in America’s future.
author: jimgeraghty

text:
The Texan pledged he could restore America’s sense of pride. On the stump, he rarely went deep into policy specifics. He preferred to emphasize that we were better than the flaws of the president, and that honor and dignity could return to the Oval Office.
http://bit.ly/2UNKRTL
author: jimgeraghty

text:
His boring vice president was regularly trotted out to tout the president’s virtues, and most members of the president’s party echoed his claims that the work of the special counsel was a partisan witch hunt.

http://bit.ly/2UNKRTL
author: jimgeraghty

text: The Texan’s party was hungry for a winner. They had experienced a shocking defeat to a president they deemed a national embarrassment and even illegitimate — a shameless, scandal-ridden womanizer up to his neck in crooked land deals and who lied as easily as he breathed.
author: jimgeraghty

text:
Surprisingly early in his political career, he chose to run for president. Despite having only been in a major office for six years, the Texan’s party saw great potential in him, and responded with a wave of donations.

http://bit.ly/2UNKRTL
author: jimgeraghty

text:
The Texan was elected in a good year for his party and managed to get reelected in a year when the national winds were against his party. The national media descended upon Texas, writing about him and asking whether he was the future of the party.

http://bit.ly/2UNKRTL
author: jimgeraghty

text:
His wife was a great asset, although she had never been a huge fan of his political ambitions. She worried about how her husband’s political life would affect their children.

http://bit.ly/2UNKRTL
author: jimgeraghty

text:
His rivals saw a lightweight, coasting on charm and charisma and good humor, with limited serious thought about difficult issues. 

http://bit.ly/2UNKRTL
author: jimgeraghty

text:
He believed immigration brought great benefits to America, and that illegal immigrants should be treated with dignity and respect — and an opportunity to become a citizen if they had avoided serious legal trouble.

http://bit.ly/2UNKRTL
author: jimgeraghty

text:
He talked a good game about controlling spending and reducing the size of government, but his instinct that government had a duty to help people usually won out in budget fights.

http://bit.ly/2UNKRTL
author: jimgeraghty

text:
Rivals and critics in both parties saw him as a servant of his donors, mixing business and government, capable of making a backroom real-estate deal sound like a public service aimed to help everyone.

http://bit.ly/2UNKRTL
author: jimgeraghty

text:
But when an opportunity in Texas politics appeared, he took it, out-hustling a Democratic incumbent who had been far too confident about the voters’ mood on Election Day.

http://bit.ly/2UNKRTL
author: jimgeraghty

text:
He eventually tried his hand at entrepreneurship, swearing he never wanted to be a politician like his father. 

http://bit.ly/2UNKRTL
author: jimgeraghty

text:
But he met a woman from a good family, who works in education, and marriage and parenthood brought maturity and stability to his life — the bottle stopped becoming such an issue in his life.

http://bit.ly/2UNKRTL
author: jimgeraghty

text:
Years later, people would ask if the family connections spared him the worst possible legal consequences of his reckless behavior in his younger years.

http://bit.ly/2UNKRTL
author: jimgeraghty

text:
Young adulthood was a surprisingly difficult time for a young man who grew up with so many advantages; too much partying, a sense of prolonged adolescence, hitting rock bottom with run-ins with the law after drinking too much and getting behind the wheel.

http://bit.ly/2UNKRTL
author: jimgeraghty

text: He went off to boarding and prep school on the East Coast, then on to the Ivy Leagues.
author: jimgeraghty

text: A Texan, the son of a man prominent in state politics and a success in life. The Texan grew up with alternating affection for and intermittent tension with his well-known, accomplished father, with the heavy question of how he would ever emerge from his father’s shadow.
author: jimgeraghty

text: Pull up a chair, dear readers, and listen to the tale of the Texan who overcome youthful misbehavior, including drinking too heavily and getting behind the wheel, to rise to the top of national politics. https://www.nationalreview.com/the-morning-jolt/republicans-dont-underestimate-beto-orourke/ …
author: jimgeraghty

text: Under the U.S. Constitution, it is not the job of the American government to finance news organizations. I’d argue foreign countries’ experience with government-funded news organizations and the groupthink within illustrates the point well.
author: jimgeraghty

text: Will the Democratic Presidential Primary Polls Change Much?
author: jimgeraghty

text: Thank you!
author: jimgeraghty

text: I think it’s likely that the Supreme Court would rule those laws in violation of the Constitution, but you never know how the court will rule until they actually consider it.
author: jimgeraghty

text: What we’re being told is “a major problem in our democracy” is a combination of odd flukes (bad Dem candidate, failure to campaign in WI, narrow Trump victory in FL, NC, PA, MI, etc.) and people want to rewrite the Constitution over it.
author: jimgeraghty

text: Accurate as that is, that argument only works on people who know the difference between the two.
author: jimgeraghty

text: My suspicion is that of a Democrat wins the presidency in 2020, most advocates of a national popular vote lose interest in the idea immediately.
author: jimgeraghty

text:
“It’s always the same states that matter, nothing ever changes”

Dude, do you even history?
author: jimgeraghty

text: Heck, in just the last three cycles we’ve seen Florida, North Carolina, Ohio, Indiana, Iowa, Michigan, Wisconsin, Pennsylvania, Indiana and Nebraska and Maine’s lone electors flip.
author: jimgeraghty

text: Bill Clinton won a whole bunch of states that Democrats now think of as heavily GOP.
author: jimgeraghty

text: States that have been won by both parties in the past six elections: AR, AZ, CO, FL, IA, IN, KY, LA, MI, MO, NC, NH, NM, NV, OH, PA, TN, VA, WI, WV, Maine’s Electoral vote.
author: jimgeraghty

text: Jimmy Carter won Texas!
author: jimgeraghty

text: Notice the language thrown around here - “my vote never counts.” Of course your vote _counts_. You just reside in a state where more folks consistently prefer the other party. Your favorite candidate doesn’t have to win for your vote to “count."
author: jimgeraghty

text: You’ve probably barely heard anything about Andrew Yang, or the #YangGang. In June, you’ll see him up on the Democratic debate stage with Sanders, Beto, Kamala and the rest.
author: jimgeraghty

text:
Put Andrew Yang up on that televised debate stage, with his confident-entrepreneur-pitching-a-room-full-of-venture-capitalists style,  and who knows? He'll probably stand out and be more interesting than the half-dozen career-legislator automatons.

http://bit.ly/2Cvc867
author: jimgeraghty

text:
Andrew Yang’s proposals for the field of journalism alone are, depending upon your point of view, visionary, out-of-the-box, nuts, or wildly beyond the proper role of government in a Constitutional republic.

http://bit.ly/2Cvc867

text:
The Democratic National Committee’s decision to open up the presidential primary debates to anyone who can get 65,000 donors means viewers are going to see all kinds of obscure new faces in June.

text: In my last NR article, I wrote, "It wouldn't take that much effort to paint the baby-faced O'Rourke as an overgrown teenager."
author: jimgeraghty

text:
Democrats can only imagine how 2018 would have been even better if, say, $20 million of the $80 million that went to Beto’s Senate campaign in 2018 had been sent to Abrams, Gilllum, Nelson and Cordray.

http://bit.ly/2UF5Vvw
author: jimgeraghty

text: Sure, maybe some Democrats and lefty media have turned on O’Rourke because he’s an obstacle to their preferred candidates. But I think it’s also an increasing belief that the Betomania of 2018 was a misallocation of resources.
author: jimgeraghty

text:
O’Rourke’s split-the-baby approach to the AR-15 is to ban the sale of new rifles, but allow current owners to keep the ones they have. Apparently, it’s safe enough for everyone to keep, but also so dangerous that no one should be allowed to get another.

http://bit.ly/2UF5Vvw
author: jimgeraghty

text:
Yikes. In the past 24-48 hours, the tone of the media coverage of Beto O’Rourke changed so suddenly and so intensely that I almost feel sorry for the guy.

http://bit.ly/2UF5Vvw

text:
Democrats have responded to the Trump era by yearning to tear it all down and start over: Eliminate the Electoral College. Add more justices to the Supreme Court. Ban private health insurance and enact Medicare for All. Raise top tax rate to 70-90%.

text:
Nominating Joe Biden atop the Democratic ticket is like giving the wacky neighbor supporting character on a beloved show his own spinoff.

http://bit.ly/2UF2zIZ

text: The key pieces of Biden’s 2020 appeal to Democrats is his Obama connection and the belief that he can beat Trump, or at least compete, among blue-collar whites. Nobody’s looking for a candidate who really knows how to sing the praises of Amtrak.

text:

text:
I hate to say it to Delaney, Klobuchar, Castro, Hickenlooper, Gabbard, Gillibrand and Inslee, but while it’s possible one or maybe even two of them will catch fire, most of them will not catch fire and will remain obscure also-rans.

text:
The hard lesson of 2016 is that if the field is crowded, you have to build up your name identification and reputation among voters before you run for president, not during your campaign.

http://bit.ly/2UJ99y2

text: Thank you!

text: Ryan Fitzpatrick is on the Josh McCown plan to complete a collection of game-worn uniforms from all 32 NFL franchises.
author: jimgeraghty

text: Happy Saint Patrick's day everyone. Drink some Guinness, eat some corned beef and cabbage, and escape U.S. marshal Samuel Gerard.
author: jimgeraghty

text: Who could possibly not like what you have to say?
author: jimgeraghty

text:
This line: "In that magical season of running against Ted Cruz, Beto, at last, was being called “a rock star.” The very thing he wanted to be in the first place!” 

Trump ran for president to boost his brand (at least according to Michael Cohen). Maybe Beto wants an album deal.
author: jimgeraghty

text: Oh, man. @rkylesmith. “He couldn’t have stuck out much more than Miracle Whip at the mayonnaise convention.”
author: jimgeraghty

text: I am rarely a defender of Maccagnan, but if this assessment is accurate, the reluctance to put a big offer on the table for Paradis makes more sense.
